name: Carrie Bloomston
bio: Artist, mom, creativity enabler, author, teacher, textile designer, maker, seeker, & feeler-of-feelings.

social_posts.post_text: Book nerds and writers you’re gonna love #grammarforafulllife by #lawrenceweinstein. I’m now in love with the colon. #carriebloomston #booknerds #writersunite #theunexaminedlifeisnotworthliving

I am grateful for this fun feature about living life creatively in the March issue of @greenlivingmag. Thank you for your creative vision and support of me and my work @shelbs_in_phx. The issue is beautiful! On stands now. #carriebloomston #creativityenabler #greenlivingmagazine #shelbytuttle

It’s a lovely Arizona day for my girl’s dive meet, and the @patternsbyannie #catchallcaddy tote in my new Found batik fabric for @anthologybatikfabrics is perfect for sunscreens, books, and hats. I love all of Annie’s patterns because they make life more well-organized. #carriebloomston #foundbatiks #foundfabric #foundcollection #windhamfabrics #batiks #batikfabric #modernbatik #anthologyfabrics #getorganized #sewingpatterns #modernsewing

TV! What a fun morning it was filming in on the set of @arizonasfamily with @tessrafolstv and @craigouthier from @phxmagazine. We spoke about living a creative life using whatever you have on hand including all these blooming spring wildflowers in Arizona. Nominations are now open for Phoenix Magazine’s Best of the Valley. Go check out the many categories and nominate your faves. Huge humongous thanks to @elainavpr for being kickass at PR and amazing friend. If you haven’t bought my newest book #thebigbookoflittlesparks, what are you waiting for?! It’s available everywhere books are sold. @ctpublishing @windhamfabrics #carriebloomston #creativityenabler

Here’s the clip from today on @arizonasfamily speaking with @tessrafolstv about living a creative life by noticing everything around you. Huge thanks to @elainavpr and @phxmagazine @craigouthier for helping this happen. @elainavpr❤️

When I prepared for the @arizonasfamily segment yesterday, I gathered simple, quick prompts to ignite creativity using only what you have around you. I looked around my house for pigments, and all of these were on hand. Curry, turmeric, onion skins, wine, coffee, berries. You can make ink and paint using any staining material in your spice drawer, fridge, or collected outside. The pigments are fugitive because they aren’t bound or lightfast, yet the process of painting with what you have on hand is direct and rich. It adds a sense of agency to the process of making and removes the feeling of lack that arises when we feel we must invest hundreds of dollars in art materials to even make a beginning. What are your fave homemade ink pigments? #carriebloomston #creativityenabler #makeabeginning #makearteverhwhere #handmadeinks #diyink #diypaint #makeink

You *can* make something from nothing. Found and scavenged materials are the best kind. I made this little landscape collage using nothing but @chocolove chocolate wrappers. There’s a teensy saguaro in the distance. 🌵 #foundart #inspirationiseverywhere #carriebloomston #foundpaper #foundtext #foundimage #collage

The joy of a vintage 1975 Porsche 914! My son @ronankeul is incredibly cool. He got this car over Christmas and is fixing it up. He learned to drive a stick and says something about the bushings needing to be replaced. He’s reading a book about carburetors. The education this car offers is worth its weight in gold. Self-driven educational pursuits shape lives. I’m so proud of and in awe of what he can do. What even is a carburetor?! (Also, just for the folks like me who worry about such things, this will never be a daily or weekly car for him–it’s more like a movable piece of art he can take to car meets.) #makersgonnamake #proudmama #creativitytakesmanyforms #creativityenabler #lifeisart #vintageporsche #porsche914 
#1975porsche914
The Fig has landed! 24 hours of Figgy love…#gspoftheday #calmdown #gspsofinstagram @germainegsp

I spend a lot of time supporting you in your creativity, yet I think it’s time to finally share how the creative brain and the creative life definitely come with some downsides. Here is the first one that comes to mind. I’ll share more soon. #carriebloomston #ceativityenabler #creativelife

My pots outta the kiln! Drippy #cone5 satin Mayco glaze on handmade terracotta coil pots. #carriebloomston #pottersgonnapot #authenticity #maker #honestexpression #claypot #cone6 #coilpot #honestmarks #plantlove #makingpots #creativityfound #createcommune #createexplore #ceramicaartesanal #cerámica #pottery #slayallday #creativelife #terracotta #earthenware #mayco

Oh my gosh, ya’ll. She pees everywhere. She bites everything. She’s up at night. She cries in her kennel. And we are smitten. I feel so grateful that we have this chance to raise a puppy together. We forget how very tender everything is–how we all need to love and be loved with such affection–how good it smells to hold a warm puppy or baby or small living thing–how good it feels to be held and loved as if I were a warm baby puppy. #figgypudding #fig #carriebloomston #gspsofinstagram
This (very) tired art teacher is so stinking proud of her students! Congrats to all the art, music, and theater teachers! #artswalk #artshow @phoenix_country_day_school #artswalk2023

The first pic is from yesterday when I’m beyond tired, elated, and grateful from head to toe for the love of my family. (Then swipe for so many more cute pics!) The big year-end art show was a success. My husband @wildsoulwildmind inspires and challenges me to grow still after 28 years. My kickass kids, who, by all accounts, sucked at showering me with affection on Mother’s Day, “…because it’s a made-up holiday, mom!” They said, “because we adore you every day and love you so much, mom!” Which is the absolute truth, they do! And I love them with every particle of my human existence. (I was born when they were.) They are my yesterday, today, and tomorrow. Anyway, so then there are my mom and dad who I feel so lucky to love, and then there’s my epic job as a middle school art teacher and also this whole thing I do with helping folks be creative and getting to design fabric and write books. And then all my beautiful friends and colleagues. And all of you here listening to me drone on about what I’m grateful for. You know why? Because gratitude is a practice and a way of life. The more I stay with what I’m grateful for, the better I feel. Gratitude is mental health support, spiritual practice, and the path destined to always head towards attracting more goodness, more love, more gratitude. Gratitude makes me remember the reason for all of this and the reason never changes: The reason we are here is to love, and possibly to be loved, but definitely to love, with all our heart and without guards, governors, or limits. To dissolve into the twinkling beauty of loving palpably all that exists around us. Like we’re drunkards, just as Rumi says. Grateful for you. Thank you. #carriebloomston #gratitudepractice #gratitudeistheway #thankful #tiredandhappy #mothersday #somuchtobethankfulfor

Here are some incredible pics from the annual art show starting with the clay food buffet. They’re sixth-grade artists! What?!?! Behold the awesomesauce of the #clayfood #lowfireclay #ceramics #artschoolforkids

When I asked my husband to name his favorite part of the student art show, he didn’t miss a beat, “The pinch pots with the faces; every year, they just make me smile!” I love those fifth grade #pinchpotcreatures so much, too! The creativity and imagination is epic! #middleschoolart #artclass #artteachersofinstagram #carriebloomston #pinchpotfaces

Swipe to see the 5th grade @granthaffner landscapes in one place! The kids learned so much and loved understanding vanishing points and orthogonal lines. #onepointperspective #artteachersofinstagram #carriebloomston #granthaffner

My dad came to the desert to watch his granddaughter move from middle school to upper school. He was supposed to come on the exact day three years before for his grandson, but COVID happened. When I am in my dad’s presence, I feel safer somehow. More grounded. Happy. He is 80 now, and he still smokes Marlboro Lights, Shorts. Still smoking after my whole lifetime of smoking. Still golfing after my whole lifetime of golfing. Still friendship with my mom, his ex-wife, after my whole lifetime (they divorced thirty years ago). He said to me, “I’m sorry but I have to talk to you about it. I don’t want to be in that plot in the cemetery where mom and dad are buried. They will cremate me, and I’d like for you to take half of the ashes and do whatever you want with them. I’m sorry but we have to talk about it.” It was so out of the blue. We were sitting enjoying the stunning and surprisingly cool desert weather. My son was sitting on the tree swing nearby looking at his phone when he heard the conversation. I began to cry and told my dad that when, far from now, that day comes, the world will be a little bit sadder for him not being in it. I told him that my son has his hands if not his smell. I told him he has 31 years left to get to 111 because 11:11 is our family number. My son heard the tears in my voice and very gently turned the tree swing the opposite way so we wouldn’t see the tears in his eyes. He was born one day after his grandfather whose hands he has. One day and 63 years after. January 31. My two watery aquarians. I’m bookended by their birthdays and loved so well sandwiched between two beautiful men. Photo by him @ronankeul on his vintage film camera taken on Wednesday. Life is so beautiful. One of my favorite lines in that @nickmulvey song, In Your Hands: “Can know the world as a lover, can know the world as an enemy. Oh, so many never know the difference. Come step in the dark with me.” That says it: Live your life in pursuit of love. Take the world as a lover, not an enemy. Be open hearted. One day someone’ll send themselves to you as a box of ashes and you’ll have to decide if you did well in loving them. I hope for all of us that we did.

I saw these today. They drew me in with their beauty, so I got closer and crouched. Swipe to see that they’re spent hibiscus flowers. Wrung out from all their showy labor of attracting pollinators and bearing fruits. They are even more beautiful cast off on the ground–twisted umbrellas of carmine, fuchsia, and pale aubergine. They are in a different phase of life, but still so astonishingly beautiful and far more quiet than their earlier display. When I saw them on the ground, I felt Ike I was looking in the mirror. Later this summer, when I turn 51 I’ll remember this reminder of the work I’m here to do: Surrender. Unfurl. Retreat. Keep my cards close at hand and my secrets radiating from the folds in my surface. To be quiet within myself and know that it’s enough. To know that I’m enough and beautiful. Todays spiritual teaching came from hibiscus. #aging #carriebloomston #hibiscusflower #flordejamaica #hibiscus #seasonsoflife

I’m incredibly excited to share my new set of drawing pencils that dropped with @ctpublishing! Use the link in bio to buy yours today. I curated this artistic set of five drawing pencils including 2B, 4B, 6B, HB, and 2H, and a paper blending stick which are my faves and most used when I draw. The high-quality artist pencils are made in the USA and feature wrapped art from my textile designs. Can’t wait to share more this week. Stay tuned! #carriebloomston #ctpublishing#artistpencils#drawingpencils #sketchsketchsketchsketch #drawsomething

Here it is, people! In this 11 minute video I show you my new set of drawing pencils and discuss why you would even want darker and lighter pencils as an artist. I will talk you through how an artist holds a pencil and how to use a blending stick to blend values. Link in bio to buy my new pencil set for yourself or an artist you love. I love that each pencil is wrapped in my textile designs! Xoxoxox #carriebloomston #drawingpencils #littleboxofartistpencils #howtodraw #ctpublishing

How to hold a pencil like an artist:
You let go.
You let the tool take you where you need to go.
And it’s not by controlling it. 
It’s by listening to it.
By honoring it. 
By trusting it. 
Link to buy my new pencil set in bio! 
#drawingtutorial #howtoholdapencil #carriebloomston #littleboxofartistpencils #drawdrawdraw #artisthack #howtodraw #ctpublishing

It was 118 degrees in PHX today so there was nothing to do but to draw in the baby pool. Watch to see the relaxed hand an artist uses when searching for shapes and forms while drawing observationally with a 4B pencil and blending stick. Link in bio to get new pencil set for @ctpublishing. #carriebloomston #eucalyptusleaves #draweverydamnday #draweverywhere @minnidip #drawdrawdraw #drawingisseeing #phxartist #littleboxofartistpencils

Ok folks, it’s my fave time of year. I told you about my new pencils (and where to buy them at the link in bio), so now I can ease into summer and hop off social media for my 10th annual break. I’m having an epic summer with my family, and I am wishing you such connection, reverie, and just totally good summer vibes wherever you are. I hope you crawl into a really good book or ten. I hope you daydream while staring out the window at the hot days. And eat some great melons and inhale the warmth and sunshine. Sending you love from the baby pool. See ya soon. Xoxo #carriebloomston #annualsocialmediafast

Hi again. I’m still in the baby pool. It’s still 110 degrees. Summer was good. Summer was hot. I worked out a lot. It was good to have a break, and I’m so grateful to have had a pretty easy start to the school year. How are ya’ll? Things of note: double piercings, Sza, Drake, teenage household, surrender, failure, resilience, love. Tia Williams’s Seven Days in June was a great read, but I really didn’t read much or watch much (other than The Bear) or eat much or travel much. We just vibed. Drove around listening to music at night in the dark with my girl. Tennis with my guy. Racquetball with my boys. And me. And me I am here in the baby pool. Anyway hi again. I haven’t felt like I have too much to say. But I want you to know that my husband has opened his private practice as a therapist (mental health). More soon on that and fabric. ❤️

My guy has some news! I am incredibly excited for my husband, Kris Keul, today: After being in a group private practice as a therapist (in mental health) for ten years, he has opened his own private practice and is accepting new clients at his Arcadia/Phoenix office. I know I am biased, but he has true gifts for helping people sift through their emotions, behaviors, and impact on others. His journey through sobriety allows him to be a wounded healer who can authentically, knowingly, and vulnerably stand with people in their pain, mirror them, and help them walk through to the other side. I am so proud of him and hope you will keep him on your list of referrals. He sees individuals and couples (not kids). Read more/schedule on his website: www.KrisKeulCounseling.com. Thank you for sharing with members of our Arizona community needing emotional support. @wildsoulwildmind I love you ❤️ #mentalhealth #therapy #phoenixtherapist #arcadiaaz #therapyhelps #getunstuck

The fifth-grade students start with magical animals each year because they looooove it. I tweaked the lesson a bit and am excited to see what these students are up to. Here is the first class done! Kids are so cool! #magicalanimals #petportraits #middleschoolart #carriebloomston #mixedmedia #collage

I had the loveliest chat with soulful @rickytims for @thequiltshowsocial last May. We spoke about how to make Soul Boxes, living a creative life, and how to stop sabotaging your creative practice. It was honoring to be asked to appear on The Quilt Show, and I’m grateful for Ricky’s ability to hold authentic conversations. Link in profile to view the episode #3306 (out now) using a free seven-day trial or free to members who subscribe. The quiltshow.com #carriebloomston #soulboxes #thequiltshow #creativepractice

Mostly we filter, alter, tweak, crop, edit, pose, enhance, tilt the head, puff the lips, square the angle, chase the Golden Hour light, and generally heighten our visual world through digital alterations to present a better view, a more beautiful scene, a prettier face. But there is nothing more beautiful to me than the way we look in the shapes we make together, almost always on our little sofa in our little house together. Most of the moments are unphotographable or objectively uninteresting to the outside observer. Sometimes we’re mad, frustrated, peaceful, joyful, laughing, connected, or gentle. But always these shapes of these bodies makes me feel like I know where my gravity is. Where I belong. Where everything matters. I love us. I love us so much. #myfamily #carriebloomston
Longing for simpler days. Sometimes we’re just extra. I am craving a return to some simplicity.

Be the change. Do the work. Recover your soul/heart/mind. Dig around in yourself. Look in the mirror until you like what you see. Healed people are the opposite of hurt people. Admit when you’re wrong. Change. Apologize to those you’ve offended. Be a helper. Be an upstander. “Be a lamp, or a lifeboat, or a ladder…help someone’s soul heal. Walk out of your house like a shepherd.” Be a lighthouse or a safe space. Your wholeness and open heart will light the path for those in the dark. #healedpeoplehealpeople #carriebloomston #rumi

Oh, Frida, we can never get enough of you! This was the third year my fifth graders celebrated #LatinHeritageMonth and stepped into art history in the #FridaKahloSelfieBooth. They were incredibly creative with their props and makeup, and we had a blast. Frida’s legacy of claiming space by not conforming to conventional and constricting definitions of beauty is a powerful lesson even for fifth graders. She is tough, and we love her! #welovefridakahlo♥️ #carriebloomston #fridakahlo #fridakahloselfie #LHM

My kid is now a man. With a brain and a heart and big interesting thoughts. Next year he goes to college. This year he works a full time job as a jiu jutsu teacher after school and has a full-time side-hustle buying and selling vintage cameras. He took the first shot of me on film. I took the shots of him taking night photos this week. We wandered around in the dark. He noticed the fluorescent lighting inside the closed after-hours Speedy Loans building and said, “It’s perfect. It’s beautifully depressing light.” I knew what he meant because I’m an artist. I just didn’t realize he is one too. I love you so much @ronankeul. Being your mom is the best part of the life I have lived. You and Lu. Dad agrees. Also, you’re an excellent photographer.
Here’s one not-painful thing today. Enjoy! #surrealisteyepumpkin #eyepumpkin #artteacherpumpkin #artheals #carriebloomston #pumpkincarving #happyhalloween

Yay, it’s finally here! I am thrilled to announce that my first batik collection, Found, is in stores around the 🌍 now! It is always stellar to work with my team at @anthologybatikfabrics and @windhamfabrics. Myiesha Williams beautifully shepherded this collaborative effort with her brilliant eye for color and design. It was really important to me to honor the old art form of batik dyeing while bringing my sensibility of found and collected markmaking to the table. The result feels modern and fresh, and I hope you will love sewing with it! In stores now. Thank you @myimyisweetiepie for being a fabric whisperer! Thank you, Anthology and Windham for asking me to create this line. I love it. #foundbatiks #foundbatikcollection #carriebloomston #foundfabriccollection #batik #modernbatiks #sewinista #quiltersgonnaquilt #quiltylove #sewyourstash #quiltmarket #anthologybatikfabrics #houstonquiltmarket2023

There is a rock slide of words waiting at my mouth: all the unspoken shock, horror, grief, and fear that we are too afraid to speak about is piling up. The attacks in Israel were sickening. The ongoing attacks in Gaza are sickening. On both sides are dehumanization and entrenched beliefs. Everyone is calling everyone an animal. Animals couldn't do this. Animals aren't capable of such horrors with only teeth and claws; they lack the capacity to kill thousands of innocent people in a couple of weeks. Only humans can do this. All of it is wrong, but more killing can't be the answer. Who will be left to grieve for the lost? Who will bake the bread? Who will sweep up? Who will bring the water? Who will lay flowers at the graves? Who will tend to the souls and psyches of the living and all the decades of trauma people will live with for the rest of their lives about what they have experienced this month? And how about the rage? Who will hold the sobbing shoulders of those who have lost their whole families whether in a kibbutz or a hospital blast or a bombing of a whole city block in Gaza? I have seen more dead and dying children in my feed in the past few weeks than I ever thought possible. Even one is too many. And what of the suffering of so many innocent hostages? Find your humanity. This must stop. #ceasefireagainandagain (These words are written because I can’t keep them anymore. We need to all help this stop, regardless of viewpoint, religion, or ethnicity. We need to feel our humanity. We need to tell the innocent victims of these atrocities that we are grieving with them and for them. We need to show support and care and concern, not fear, ignorance, or even deeply held beliefs.)

Diwali is my favorite day on my school’s campus. For the fifth year, we created a #rangoli with the students to celebrate the Indian Festival of Lights. The act of crouching close to the earth in the cool early-morning autumn air and creating art with nothing but one’s hands is incredibly meditative, inviting contemplative reflection and bodily awareness. I arrive the day before to chalk in the large image. This year, several folks suggested a #peacockrangoli. We used flour, dirt, beans, grains, colored powders, and flowers to create the temporary design with our hands. Hoping your Diwali brings health, wealth, and happiness.

I love this Diwali blessing written by the inspiring artist and creator Mukul Bhatia of @Foundintranslations, “Diwali is all about moving away from the darkness into the light of healing.” Happy Diwali! 🪔 

#mandala #rangoli #carriebloomston #artteachersofinstagram #makearteverywhere #naturemandala #middleschoolart #deepavali #diyas #makemeaning #muggulu #diya #happydiwali

Erm…about my tenth fabric collection. Ah hem. I freaking love it! The batik process is so full of magic. I love seeing my prints rendered in the softer style of wax resist. Find the Found collection at your local quilt shop around the 🌍. @anthologybatikfabrics #carriebloomstonfabric #foundbatikcollection #Foundfabriccollection #carriebloomston #anthologyfabrics #quiltlove #batikquilt #quiltersgonnaquilt #windhamfabrics

I need to explain something about Fig. Remember our puppy? Remember when we got her last spring and it was all surprise and sweetness and light and puppy naps? Well, that was short lived. By June she had turned into basically just a problem, and then she became sort of like a demon, lol, not really! (But actually, really! I mean I did begin to hate her and fantasize about taking her to a far away farm with some nice farmers and lots of land for her to roam.) So, by June she would try to initiate play with Luna our seven-year-old #germanshorthairedpointer by biting her throat constantly. The ensuing chaos and ruckus and play-fighting grew in loudness and intensity all summer until it was just eight hours of daily horribleness in our house. I’d dream up reasons to get out of the house. We were all frustrated, and our attempts to placate and train her cooped up in the Phoenix summer heat weren’t working. My colleague told me about his dog trainer who offered basically “sleepaway camp” for a couple of weeks at which they keep the dog and do daily training. I was SO skeptical. And bitter about having to spend money on a demon dog! But I was at my wit’s end. So over fall break we sent her to camp. And guess what?!? It freaking worked! And I love my dog again, and she is so fun and funny and well-behaved and we have skills to work with her. She listens to her commands. She has a hilarious personality! (The dog trainer Lauren described Fig as a “theater kid” because she is so demonstrative and makes a big fuss about how she feels about doing things and sort of exaggerates her movements. So funny.) Lauren is an absolute boss and brilliant trainer. She is truly a dog whisperer and gave us so much insight. At camp, they walk them every day to coffee houses so all the dogs are socialized with other dogs and in public spaces. So now we take Figgy to the farmer’s market and she’s a dream! We are so grateful to @destination_dog_training_ for fixing our problem child. We love her now. If you have a dog of any age needing training, they are incredible. I can’t recommend them highly enough. #carriebloomston #destinationdogtraining #gspofinstagram #gspoftheday #gspsofinstagram

I feel so much gratitude for the gift of being an art teacher and part of a magical school. It’s really important to count, name, speak, write, share, and list our blessings and gratitudes on this day and every day. Being grateful is my predominant form of prayer. #gratefuleveryday #carriebloomston #artteacher #thankful #middleschoolart

No one would make a serious face in our Thanksgiving pics but I got this one! At the extreme tiptop of the pyramid of all the epic and glorious things I’m grateful for there is my family. None of it makes sense without them. They’re the reason.

There are too many Mona Lisas to fit in one picture, but please take a look at the visible identities my epic fifth graders brought into their multicultural Mona Lisa paintings! They shared their heritage and ethnicity, race, religion, ability, and gender if they chose through visual symbols such as jewelry, clothing, flags, architecture, and maps. Their creativity is off the charts, and their interpretations of the Mona Lisa are so alive. We painted skin tone with coffee + watercolor to achieve one their shades of skin and looked at the brilliant work of @angelicadass for inspiration and understanding of the thousands of shades of human skin she has captured in her work. #monalisa #monalisasmile #carriebloomston #middleschoolart #leonardodavinci

Last night at the Crescent Ballroom with my husband and a room full of Phoenix’s most interesting hipsters, I listened to the soulful vibes of @yussefdayes and realized in the middle of the show that I was taking notes in my phone in typical nerd fashion. I wrote down this sentence, “just close your eyes & feel.” I was reminded of this spiritual teaching I have lived by. Used to live by. The wisdom I remember and forget over and over and teach to my students when painting or working with clay. But this here this is what is up. We don’t need to see it to know it. Close your eyes and feel. We here are too cognitive and too reliant on our dominant senses. Just feel. Let your body be your teacher and your guide. Feel the vibrations the rhythms the sorrow the grief the ecstatic pulsing joy of living. The being human. The bathtub crying. The midnight hot flash. The tender kindness of being witnessed. The honoring shoulder tap. The cool breeze. Close your eyes and feel it all. Go within to see more clearly. Turn down the noise of thinking thinking thinking. As I say to my students: Leave your brain in your locker. Your body knows everything. Your body is your brain.  Thinking is highly highly overrated. Love you. xoxo #carriebloomston

Kiln unloading day is THE bestest day! I did a new project with my fifth graders: I asked them to create little functional dishes around the theme of growing. The super open ended prompt yielding wildly creative objects! #5thgradeceramics #cone06 #clayart #claystudio #littledishes #anthrostyle #middleschoolart #elementaryart #anthropologie #meltedmarbles #lowfireclay #clayart #ceramicsclass #artteachersofinstagram #carriebloomston

Oh, hi, and Merry Christmas if you celebrate! I hope your day was awesome. My biggest advice to artists? Listen to every whisper. Especially the quietest ones. Especially the weirdest ones that you don’t fully understand. Especially if they land in your brain and heart unprompted and without any prior thought–those are usually the best. The stuff you’ve made over and over and over again probably needs to be put to bed. It’s just our own artist version of auto-pilot, as in, “I get a lot of love/praise/props/adoration for doing this sort of work, so I guess it’s good enough then.” Who really even cares? What’s good enough is what ignites you. Be lit up. Be a bonfire. Stop putting out the embers. Just go meet yourself in the weird backstreets of the soul and figure out what inspires you to discover more. I had the thought yesterday to cast all the convex and concave parts of my body in clay–to record the shapes of the negative spaces in white clay. It certainly isn’t groundbreaking, but I’ve never cast my collarbones or the palm of my hand in clay before, even though I’ve made molds of much of my body in plaster gauze. I’m gonna figure out these shapes. My job is to answer the whispers, if I’m able. When we don’t have a crystallized path forward, that’s the good stuff. When everything is super clear, we haven’t invited in not-knowing. I really want to not-know things. #beginnersmind #carriebloomston
Winter break is my favorite time of the year with my favorite people on earth. I am wishing you joy, peace, and love in 2024. Photographs by my son @ronankeul.

1 of 2 Happy 2024, beautiful people! I hope you learn even more about yourself and the world this year. I’m posting my new year’s intentions video next. I’m incredibly grateful for the connection we share in this space and for your support of my work as an artist, designer, teacher, writer, seeker, and mom. The algorithm may have changed, but the connection is real. I’m wishing you such love for yourself and others this year. Thank you, friends.

2 of 2 Happy 2024! I’m incredibly grateful for the connection we share in this space and for your support of my work as an artist, fabric designer, teacher, writer, seeker, and mom. What are your intentions? Do you have a word of the year? One of mine is #organize and another is #acceptance.

If you can stick with the first minute of me being grateful for the magic teaching middle school art and being around these little beings, I get to the good stuff about how when we show up as our full selves at work or in any aspect of life, we can find a holy, sustainable, nurturing, spiritual practice. xoxo thx for listening
